thread.title: Japan carrier ANA launches fleet of ‘Star Wars’ themed planesTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Japan carrier ANA launches fleet of ‘Star Wars’ themed planesTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Japan carrier ANA launches fleet of ‘Star Wars’ themed planesTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Japan carrier ANA launches fleet of ‘Star Wars’ themed planes Published on : Wednesday, August 19, 2015
Producers are leaving no stone unturned to market their films. An initiative to build buzz prior to the December premiere of “Star Wars: The Force Awakens,” ANA, Japan’s largest airline, announced Tuesday that two more planes will be decorated with characters from the films.
This isn’t the first time such an initiative is being undertaken. Earlier R2-D2 ANA jet, a Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner bearing the beloved droid’s likeness was launched.
The new “Star Wars” ANA jet will feature R2-D2 on the outside of a Boeing 767-300 with his buddy BB-8, a new droid from “Star Wars: The Force Awakens.” For now, it is scheduled to start flying domestic Japanese routes in November.
Another vessel, a Boeing 777-300ER featuring the roly-poly BB-8, is scheduled to start serving international routes between Japan and North America in March.
Further to promote the upcoming the film, the planes also will offer all six “Star Wars” films as part of its in-flight entertainment on international routes.
Characters also will grace headrest covers, paper napkins and cups.
The ANA ‘Star Wars’ Project was announced in April, a partnership between the airline and Walt Disney.
